Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lid, probably from a Nikosthenic pyxis or lekanis; interior glazed black with two added red bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of battle scene; on the ground, possible shield of fallen warrior; to left, part of two advancing figures with shields in inside view, and large spears; to right, opponent facing left, with white serpentine device on shield.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0912)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL n 3 (Other Accession Number)
